FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule F, Part I, Line 3(f) GENERAL INFORMATION ON ACTIVITIES OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES
column4: THE AMOUNTS LISTED IN COLUMN (F) FOR THE UNIVERSITY'S INVESTMENTS IN CENTRAL AMERICAN/CARIBBEAN, EAST ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, AND EUROPE REFER TO THE FAIR MARKET VALUE OF INVESTMENTS FOR THAT PARTICULAR REGION, NOT SOLELY THE EXPENDITURES FOR THE FISCAL TAX YEAR ENDED 6/30/19, AS REQUIRED BY THE IRS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule F, Part I CONFERENCE-RELATED EXPENDITURES
column4: INDIRECT EXPENSES ARE NOT TRACKED FOR THESE PROGRAMS AS WE ONLY TRACK UNIVERSITY FUNDS TRANSFERRED TO FOREIGN COUNTRIES TO SUPPORT THESE PROGRAMS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule F, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
column4: GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO GOVERNMENT AND ORGANIZATIONS: GW MAINTAINS A FORMAL SUBRECIPIENT MONITORING POLICY WHICH APPLIES TO ALL SUBAWARDS ISSUED UNDER ALL SPONSORED PROJECTS AWARDED. THE POLICY APPLIES TO SUBRECIPIENTS WHO ARE ASSIGNED RESPONSIBILITY FOR CONDUCTING A PORTION OF GW'S SPONSORED PROJECT WORK. GW IS RESPONSIBLE TO THE SPONSOR FOR MANAGEMENT OF FUNDS AND FOR MEETING PERFORMANCE GOALS. GW HAS INTERNAL PROCEDURES FOR ASSESSING THE SUBRECIPIENT ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATUS AND INTERNAL CONTROLS IN ORDER TO DETERMINE WHETHER TO PROCEED WITH THE SUBRECIPIENT. BASED ON THE ASSESSMENT, TERMS AND CONDITIONS ARE ESTABLISHED IN THE SUBAWARD AGREEMENT TO BE CONSISTENT WITH THE LEVEL OF PERCEIVED RISK AND IDENTIFY SPECIFIC MONITORING ACTIVITIES. GW UNDERTAKES CERTAIN ACTIVITIES TO MONITOR SUBRECIPIENTS TO PROVIDE REASONABLE ASSURANCE THAT THEY ADMINISTER, PERFORM AND ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH APPLICABLE LAWS, REGULATIONS, TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THE PRIME AWARD AND GW'S SUBAWARD AGREEMENTS. RISK ASSESSMENT AND AWARD MONITORING PROCEDURES ARE DEFINED BY ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES AT GW AND INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO, THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR, DEPARTMENT ADMINISTRATORS, CENTRAL RESEARCH, AND FINANCIAL OFFICES WITHIN GW. GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS: THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE KEEPS RECORDS ON ITS INTEGRATED SOFTWARE SYSTEM THAT SUBSTANTIATES THE AMOUNT GRANTED TO EACH STUDENT, THE ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA FOR EACH STUDENT, AND THE SELECTION PROCESS USED IN AWARDING ASSISTANCE. THE UNIVERSITY'S GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE ARE INITIALLY CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT IN ITS INTEGRATED SOFTWARE SYSTEM IN ORDER TO PAY FOR TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD, AND/OR TEXTBOOK CHARGES. A CHANGE IN ENROLLMENT STATUS RESULTS IN WEEKLY REPORTS THAT FINANCIAL AID STAFF REVIEW FOR POSSIBLE ADJUSTMENTS. THE BALANCE OF AID IN EXCESS OF THE ABOVE CHARGES CAN BE REFUNDED TO THE STUDENT FOR LIVING EXPENSES. THE SYSTEM CHECKS THAT THE STUDENT IS STILL ENROLLED BEFORE ISSUING THE REFUND. AT THE GRADUATE LEVEL, AWARDS ARE INITIATED, CHECKED TO ENSURE ELIGIBILITY AND APPROVED BEFORE AWARDS ARE OFFERED TO A STUDENT AND A STUDENT MUST ACCEPT THE AWARD BEFORE PAYMENT PROCESSES BEGIN. QUALIFICATIONS FOR ENDOWMENT AWARDS ARE CHECKED AND THE MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS FOR AWARDS ARE CHECKED FOR EVERY ENDOWMENT AWARDEE. PAPERWORK IS KEPT IN THE OFFICE FOR THREE YEARS AND THE AWARD LETTERS ELECTRONICALLY FOR FIVE YEARS. OUR ELECTRONIC SYSTEMS, BANNER AND EAS, HAVE THE RECORDS OF PAYMENTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule F, Part I, Line 2 PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS
column4: GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO GOVERNMENT AND ORGANIZATIONS: GW MAINTAINS A FORMAL SUBRECIPIENT MONITORING POLICY WHICH APPLIES TO ALL SUBAWARDS ISSUED UNDER ALL SPONSORED PROJECTS AWARDED. THE POLICY APPLIES TO SUBRECIPIENTS WHO ARE ASSIGNED RESPONSIBILITY FOR CONDUCTING A PORTION OF GW'S SPONSORED PROJECT WORK. GW IS RESPONSIBLE TO THE SPONSOR FOR MANAGEMENT OF FUNDS AND FOR MEETING PERFORMANCE GOALS. GW HAS INTERNAL PROCEDURES FOR ASSESSING THE SUBRECIPIENT ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATUS AND INTERNAL CONTROLS IN ORDER TO DETERMINE WHETHER TO PROCEED WITH THE SUBRECIPIENT. BASED ON THE ASSESSMENT, TERMS AND CONDITIONS ARE ESTABLISHED IN THE SUBAWARD AGREEMENT TO BE CONSISTENT WITH THE LEVEL OF PERCEIVED RISK AND IDENTIFY SPECIFIC MONITORING ACTIVITIES. GW UNDERTAKES CERTAIN ACTIVITIES TO MONITOR SUBRECIPIENTS TO PROVIDE REASONABLE ASSURANCE THAT THEY ADMINISTER, PERFORM AND ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH APPLICABLE LAWS, REGULATIONS, TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THE PRIME AWARD AND GW'S SUBAWARD AGREEMENTS. RISK ASSESSMENT AND AWARD MONITORING PROCEDURES ARE DEFINED BY ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES AT GW AND INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO, THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR, DEPARTMENT ADMINISTRATORS, CENTRAL RESEARCH, AND FINANCIAL OFFICES WITHIN GW. GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS: THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE KEEPS RECORDS ON ITS INTEGRATED SOFTWARE SYSTEM THAT SUBSTANTIATES THE AMOUNT GRANTED TO EACH STUDENT, THE ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA FOR EACH STUDENT, AND THE SELECTION PROCESS USED IN AWARDING ASSISTANCE. THE UNIVERSITY'S GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE ARE INITIALLY CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT IN ITS INTEGRATED SOFTWARE SYSTEM IN ORDER TO PAY FOR TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD, AND/OR TEXTBOOK CHARGES. A CHANGE IN ENROLLMENT STATUS RESULTS IN WEEKLY REPORTS THAT FINANCIAL AID STAFF REVIEW FOR POSSIBLE ADJUSTMENTS. THE BALANCE OF AID IN EXCESS OF THE ABOVE CHARGES CAN BE REFUNDED TO THE STUDENT FOR LIVING EXPENSES. THE SYSTEM CHECKS THAT THE STUDENT IS STILL ENROLLED BEFORE ISSUING THE REFUND. AT THE GRADUATE LEVEL, AWARDS ARE INITIATED, CHECKED TO ENSURE ELIGIBILITY AND APPROVED BEFORE AWARDS ARE OFFERED TO A STUDENT AND A STUDENT MUST ACCEPT THE AWARD BEFORE PAYMENT PROCESSES BEGIN. QUALIFICATIONS FOR ENDOWMENT AWARDS ARE CHECKED AND THE MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS FOR AWARDS ARE CHECKED FOR EVERY ENDOWMENT AWARDEE. PAPERWORK IS KEPT IN THE OFFICE FOR THREE YEARS AND THE AWARD LETTERS ELECTRONICALLY FOR FIVE YEARS. OUR ELECTRONIC SYSTEMS, BANNER AND EAS, HAVE THE RECORDS OF PAYMENTS.
SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS ARE USED TO OFFSET THE COST OF TUITION. MONEY IS NOT AVAILABLE TO PERSONS NOT ENROLLED AT THE UNIVERSITY.

THE GRANTS USED OUTSIDE OF THE UNITED STATES ARE RELATED TO TUITION AND/OR HOUSING ACCOMMODATIONS MADE BY CONCORDIA UNIVERSITY CHICAGO ON BEHALF OF ITS STUDENTS TAKING PART IN ESTABLISHED STUDY ABROAD PROGRAMS. IN THESE CASES, CONCORDIA HAS ENTERED INTO AGREEMENTS WITH VARIOUS INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER EDUCATION IN ORDER TO ALLOW ITS STUDENTS TO STUDY AT A UNIVERSITY OUTSIDE OF THE UNITED STATES. THESE AGREEMENTS FACILITATE THE PAYMENT OF TUITION AND ACCOMMODATIONS BY REQUIRING THE HOME INSTITUTION TO COLLECT PAYMENT FROM THE STUDENT AND THEN FORWARD THAT PAYMENT TO THE UNIVERSITY OUTSIDE OF THE U.S.
THE ORGANIZATION IS REQUIRED TO FILE FORM 5471 BECAUSE IT MEETS THE APPLICABLE THRESHOLD OWNERSHIP OR OTHER FILING REQUIREMENTS.

ALL GRANT FUNDS AWARDED TO STUDENTS OUTSIDE OF THE UNITED STATES ARE POSTED ELECTRONICALLY BY THE BURSAR TO THE TUITION RECEIVABLE ACCOUNT FOR EACH STUDENT. THE UNIVERSITY'S ENROLLMENT SERVICES OFFICE IS PROVIDED WITH A WEEKLY REPORT IDENTIFYING ANY STUDENT REFUNDS. THESE PROCEDURES ENSURE THAT ALL FUNDS ARE BEING APPLIED AND USED FOR THEIR INTENDED EDUCATIONAL PURPOSE.
THE ACCRUAL METHOD OF ACCOUNTING IS USED TO ACCOUNT FOR THE EXPENDITURES REPORTED ON THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
THE ACCRUAL METHOD OF ACCOUNTING IS USED TO ACCOUNT FOR THE NON-CASH ASSISTANCE REPORTED ON THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

FAIRLEIGH DICKINSON UNIVERSITY OF BRITISH COLUMBIA, FOUNDATION (FDU-VANCOUVER) IS A CAMPUS OF FAIRLEIGH DICKINSON UNIVERSITY IN THE UNITED STATES. FDU-VANCOUVER was formed on July 19, 2006, incorporated UNDER THE SOCIETY ACT IN VICTORIA, BC, CANADA AND ACCREDITED BY THE BRITISH COLUMBIA MINISTRY OF ADVANCED EDUCATION.

LINDENWOOD HAS CONTRACTED WITH TWO INDIVIDUALS TO BE PART-TIME INDEPENDENT CONTRACTORS TO HELP THE UNIVERSITY RECRUIT STUDENTS IN THE CENTRAL AMERICA REGION. TOTAL FEES AND ALLOTMENT FOR OFFICE EXPENSES FOR 2019-2020 FISCAL YEAR WERE: CONTRACTOR ONE: $17,950 CONTRACTOR TWO: $26,320 TOTAL: $44,270 LINDENWOOD UNIVERSITY PAID UNIVERSIDAD DE GRANADA $11,914 FOR 2 STUDENTS TO STUDY ABROAD IN EUROPE (SPAIN). LINDENWOOD UNIVERSITY PAID UNIVERSITY STUDIES ABROAD CONSORTIUM $7,980 FOR ONE STUDENT TO STUDY ABROAD IN CENTRAL AMERICA (COSTA RICA). LINDENWOOD UNIVERSITY PAID UNIVERSITY STUDIES ABROAD CONSORTIUM $55,000 FOR 8 STUDENTS TO STUDY ABROAD IN EUROPE (ITALY). LINDENWOOD UNIVERSITY PAID UNIVERSITY STUDIES ABROAD CONSORTIUM $5,880 FOR ONE STUDENT TO STUDY ABROAD IN EUROPE (POLAND). LINDENWOOD UNIVERSITY PAID UNIVERSITY STUDIES ABROAD CONSORTIUM $87,643 FOR 8 STUDENTS TO STUDY ABROAD IN EUROPE (UK). LINDENWOOD UNIVERSITY PAID UNIVERSITY STUDIES ABROAD CONSORTIUM $7,011 FOR ONE STUDENT TO STUDY ABROAD IN SOUTH AMERICA (URUGUAY).

Birmingham-Southern College has written criteria for scholarships and grants which require formal application or nomination. This paper trail is used for internal reports, audits, and donor reports. Funds are tracked in our database software and individual files are maintained of grant/scholarship recipients. All material is subject to audit. Grant/scholarship criteria is reviewed prior to disbursement. Part III Accounting Method Grants are reported using the accrual method of accounting on the financial statements.

DURING FISCAL YEAR 2020, THE UNIVERSITY RECEIVED CONSIDERATION TOTALLING $165,000 FROM HIGHER EDUCATION INSTITUTIONS IN TURKEY, CHILE, PANAMA AND MALAYSIA UNDER AGREEMENTS WHEREBY EACH INSTITUTION UTILIZED CERTAIN CULINARY CURRICULUM OF THE UNIVERSITY AND THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDED CERTAIN OVERSIGHT OVER THE CULINARY INSTRUCTION AT EACH INSTITUTION. IN CONNECTION WITH SUCH AGREEMENTS, THE UNIVERSITY INCURRED PERSONNEL AND TRAVEL EXPENSES BY CERTAIN MEMEBERS OF ITS CULINARY FACULTY TO VALIDATE THE APPROPRIATE UTILIZATION OF SUCH CURRICULUM.
THE AMOUNT REPORTED IN PART I, LINE 3 REPRESENTS THE FAIR MARKET VALUE OF FOREIGN INVESTMENTS HELD AT THE END OF THE YEAR.

PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS OUTSIDE U.S. WASHINGTON COLLEGE AWARDED $1,158,521 IN SCHOLARSHIPS FOR 6/30/20. WASHINGTON COLLEGE OFFERS SEVERAL TYPES OF FINANCIAL AID TO HELP QUALIFIED FULL-TIME UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS MEET THEIR COLLEGE EXPENSES. COLLEGE-SPONSORED TUITION SCHOLARSHIPS, TUITION GRANTS, AND WORK/STUDY ARE AVAILABLE TO FULL-TIME UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS WHO DEMONSTRATE FINANCIAL NEED AND WHO MEET THE COLLEGE'S ADMISSION CRITERIA. IN ADDITION TO COLLEGE-SPONSORED FINANCIAL AID, ELIGIBLE STUDENTS CAN RECEIVE ASSISTANCE FROM FEDERAL, STATE, AND INDEPENDENT AID PROGRAMS. GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE FROM ALL SOURCES IS FIRST APPLIED TO FULL-TIME TUITION CHARGES. GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE IN EXCESS OF TUITION IS THEN APPLIED TO DIRECT COLLEGE CHARGES FOR FEES, AND ON CAMPUS ROOM AND BOARD. THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT MAKES FFELP FUNDS AVAILABLE TO UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS TO ATTEND POST-SECONDARY INSTITUTIONS. ELIGIBILITY IS BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED, AND APPLICATION IS THROUGH THE NORMAL FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION PROCESS OF WASHINGTON COLLEGE.

FOREIGN FORMS WASHINGTON COLLEGE INVESTS IN DOMESTIC AND FOREIGN INVESTMENT VEHICLES THAT MAY OWN AN INTEREST IN A FOREIGN CORPORATION, PASSIVE FOREIGN INVESTMENT COMPANY, OR FOREIGN PARTNERSHIP. NEVERTHELESS, WASHINGTON COLLEGE'S ACTIVITIES MAY NOT REACH THE THRESHOLDS REQUIRED FOR FILING THE FORMS 926, 5471, 8621 OR 8865. TO THE EXTENT SUCH A FORM WAS COMPLETED, IT HAS BEEN FILED WITH WASHINGTON COLLEGE'S FORM 990-T.

GRANTS AWARDED TO INDIVIDUALS OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES BY THE UNIVERSITY OF RICHMOND CONSIST OF FINANCIAL AID IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO STUDENTS STUDYING ABROAD. STUDENTS RECEIVING THESE GRANTS ARE DETERMINED TO BE WORTHY ON THE BASIS OF THE UNIVERSITY'S ASSESSMENT OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR CRITERIA. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MONITORS STUDENTS' ELIGIBILITY FOR THESE FUNDS IN ACCORDANCE WITH INSTITUTIONAL POLICIES AND STANDARDS.
Activities include European Studies and study abroad programs in Belgium, China, Ecuador, Namibia, Thailand, and the United Kingdom.

SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS FOR STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO A STUDENT'S GRINNELL COLLEGE ACCOUNT AND APPLIED TO TUITION, FEES, ROOM, AND BOARD. ALL FINANCIAL AID IS SUBJECT TO REVISION BASED ON FUND AVAILABILITY, CHANGES IN FAMILY CONTRIBUTION AND/OR CREDIT LOAD. SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS MUST BE MAINTAINED ACCORDING TO STANDARDS PRESCRIBED BY GRINNELL COLLEGE. ANNUAL RENEWAL OF FINANCIAL AID IS CONTINUOUS IF INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL NEED REMAINS, ALL REQUIRED DOCUMENTS ARE COMPLETED BY THE PUBLISHED DEADLINE AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IS MAINTAINED CONSISTENT WITH GRINNELL COLLEGE POLICY. STUDENTS AWARDED OTHER FUNDS MAKE VARIOUS REPORTS AND PRESENTATIONS ON THEIR RESEARCH OR STUDY AS REQUIRED BASED ON INDIVIDUAL REQUIREMENTS OF THE FUNDING.
FOR PURPOSES OF THIS REPORT, THE COLLEGE RELIES ON ITS INTERNAL FINANCIAL SYSTEM SOFTWARE TO REPORT AID BY THE RECIPIENTS' COUNTRY OF RESIDENCE.

MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS OUTSIDE THE U.S. THE COLLEGE OFFERS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE, IN THE FORM OF GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS, TO INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS. IN ORDER TO QUALIFY FOR THE ASSISTANCE, A STUDENT MUST BE ENROLLED FULL-TIME, MUST HAVE ACHIEVED A SATISFACTORY GRADE POINT AVERAGE, AND MUST HAVE DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED. ALL GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS ARE AWARDED BASED ON NEED AND CONFORM TO FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL REGULATIONS. THE COLLEGE HAS PROCEDURES IN PLACE FOR MONITORING GRANTS TO ENSURE PROPER COMPLIANCE.
FOREIGN EXPENDITURES ARE ACCOUNTED FOR USING THE ACCRUAL METHOD OF ACCOUNTING.

Disbursements made for grant funds outside the United States, in furtherance of Middlebury's exempt programs are made in accordance with procedures or subject to conditions established by Middlebury's governing board designed to ensure that the individuals receiving disbursements from Middlebury are adequately investigated to ensure that they are qualifying recipients. Grant sub-awardees are required to submit reports which are reviewed by the Middlebury's grant accountant. All billings are reviewed and approved by the principal investigator and grant accountant before being paid.
Expenditures are recorded on the accrual basis of accounting.

ALL FINANCIAL AID IS APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' OUTSTANDING RECEIVABLE BALANCES. NO CASH IS PHYSICALLY TRANSMITTED. CREDIT BALANCES THAT RESULT FROM FEDERAL STUDENT AND PARENT LOAN PROCEEDS ARE DISTRIBUTED TO THE BORROWER WITHIN THE SPECIFIED TIME FRAME REQUIRED BY THE REGULATIONS GOVERNING THESE PROGRAMS. ELIGIBILITY FOR NEED-BASED GRANTS, LOANS, AND WORK-STUDY FORMS OF FEDERAL STUDENT AID IS DETERMINED USING THE RESULTS OF THE FEDERAL METHODOLOGY NEED ANALYSIS FORMULA.STUDENT AID AWARDED FROM BOTH FEDERAL AND INSTITUTIONAL SOURCES ARE MONITORED CONTINUOUSLY THROUGHOUT THE FISCAL YEAR USING VARIOUS BUDGET STATUS REPORTS, STUDENT ACCOUNT STATUS REPORTS, AND DEFERRAL AND INSTITUTIONAL PROGRAM RECONCILIATION REPORTS.
procedures for monitoring the use of its grants and other assistance outside the United States

Hartland helps to raise funds for ministries that are started and operated by former staff at Hartland and by students who have completed their training here. Hartland maintains a close working relationship with these ministries. Many current students complete their internship at these affiliates.

THE FOUNDATION REQUIRES THAT FUNDS GRANTED TO THE METROPOLITAN ANDREY SHEPTYTSKY INSTITUTE OF EASTERN CHRISTIAN STUDIES AT THE UNIVERSITY OF SAINT MICHAEL'S UTILIZE THE FUNDS GRANTED BY THE FOUNDATION EXCLUSIVELY FOR THE FURTHERMENT OF THE THEOLOGICAL PROGRAM; FOR EXPENSES THAT ARE DIRECTLY FOUND IN THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION. THE GRANT FUNDS USAGE IS FURTHER DEFINED IN THE FOUNDATION'S ARTICLES OF ORGANIZATION.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE F, PART I, LINE 2
column4: PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS OUTSIDE THE U.S.: Financial aid ("grants") is awarded based on need as determined by an analysis of each applicants required submission of a College Scholarship Profile, a Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA), and (when applicable) federal tax returns. Grants awarded through the Financial Aid Office are disbursed directly to the student's tuition account where they are applied to educational charges. Grants are awarded in combination with an expected family contribution, if any, to meet an individual's educational program budget. Grants are reviewed annually for compliance by an independent audit firm.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS
column4: PART I, LINE 2 STUDENTS ATTEND APPROVED STUDY ABROAD PROGRAMS AND RECEIVE WESLEYAN CREDIT. PROGRAMS ARE APPROVED BASED ON A REVIEW BY A FACULTY COMMITTEE. ONCE THE PROGRAM IS APPROVED, THE OFFICE OF INTERNATIONAL STUDIES, IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE FINANCE OFFICE, FACILITATES PAYMENT AND FINANCIAL AID TO THE HOST SCHOOL. AFTER A STUDENT COMPLETES THE PROGRAM, THEY FILL OUT AN EVALUATION OF THE PROGRAM AND AN OFFICIAL TRANSCRIPT IS PRESENTED TO THE UNIVERSITY FROM THE PROGRAM.

PART III, COLUMN E FINANCIAL AID IS DETERMINED BASED ON A NEEDS ANALYSIS AND APPLIED TO STUDENT CHARGES THAT SUPPORT THE COST OF ATTENDANCE. STUDENT CHARGES ARE USED IN SUPPORTING THE UNIVERSITY'S MISSION. WESLEYAN ALTERNATES RUNNING FOREIGN PROGRAMS WITH VASSAR COLLEGE AND WELLESLEY COLLEGE IN SPAIN, ITALY, AND FRANCE. DURING FISCAL YEAR 2020, WESLEYAN RAN THE ITALY AND SPAIN PROGRAMS, SO EXPENSES IN THAT REGION WERE HIGHER THAN THE PRIOR YEAR WHEN THE OTHER COLLEGES RAN THE PROGRAMS.
ACCRUAL
The organization tracked expenditures in accordance with accrual basis of accounting. Foreign expenditures were tracked using expense reports and other appropriate documentation.

column4: THE UNIVERSITY HAS SIGNED AGREEMENTS WITH COOPERATING INSTITUTIONS TO ENSURE THAT GRANT PAYMENTS RECEIVED FROM THE UNIVERSITY WILL BE PROPERLY CREDITED TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNTS AT THE FOREIGN UNIVERSITIES. Form 990, Sch F, Part I, Column (F) The amounts reported in column (F), total expenditures for education and research, represent other foreign activity expenses separately identifiable by region and activity in the Universitys accounting system. The amounts reported in column (F), total expenditures for international studies, represent study abroad grants tracked separately by the international studies office. Form 990, Sch F, Part I, Line 1 Accounting Method Investments are accounted for at Fair Market Value. Program services and grantmaking are accounted for using the accrual method of accounting.
EXPENDITURES ARE ACCOUNTED FOR ON THE ACCRUAL BASIS OF ACCOUNTING.

THE COLLEGE HAS OWNERSHIP IN VARIOUS FOREIGN ENTITIES AS A RESULT OF ALTERNATIVE INVESTMENTS THAT ARE A PART OF THE COLLEGE'S INVESTMENT PORTFOLIO. THE AMOUNT REPORTED IN PART I, COLUMN F IS THE FAIR MARKET VALUE OF THE INVESTMENTS HELD AT THE END OF THE YEAR.

CONSISTENT WITH THE COLLEGE'S STUDENT FINANCIAL PROCESS, INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS APPLY FOR THE VARIOUS AID TYPES. ANY AID AWARDED IS ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS. AID IS DISBURSED TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS AS A PAYMENT ON THEIR STUDENT BILL.
BASED ON ACTUAL PAYROLL AND COSTS REIMBURSED.

THE UNIVERSITY UTILIZES SEVERAL PROCEDURES AND REPORTS ON AN ANNUAL BASIS TO MONITOR FINANCIAL AID. THE UNIVERSITY HAS INTERNAL CONTROLS IN PLACE TO ENSURE AMOUNTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO CONTINUE TO MEET AND MAINTAIN ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS. THESE CONTROLS ARE ADMINISTERED THROUGH THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.
QUINNIPIAC UNIVERSITY USES THE ACCRUAL METHOD TO ACCOUNT FOR THE GRANTS REPORTED. INVESTMENTS ARE REPORTED AT FAIR MARKET VALUE.

Grants awarded through the Financial Aid Office are disbursed directly to the student's tuition account where they are applied to educational charges. Grants are awarded in combination with an expected family contribution, if any, to meet an individual's educational program budget. INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CODED SEPARATELY IN THE COLLEGE'S ERP SYSTEM. A REPORT IS GENERATED FROM THE COLLEGE'S ERP SYSTEM DETAILING EACH STUDENT AND THEIR SPECIFIC AWARDS. THIS REPORT IS REVIEWED PERIODICALLY TO MONITOR FUNDS.

The ending ownership in these foreign investments is appropriately reported as $0 as of June 30, 2019 for the filing organization on Part I line 3.

Procedures for monitoring the use of grant funds to individuals outside the United States: Grants and assistance in furtherance of the institution's exempt programs are made to foreign students in college programs in accordance with established college procedures or are subject to conditions established by the institution's governing board designed to ensure that individuals receiving grants are adequately investigated to ensure that they are qualifying recipients. Such awards are made only to the extent of the cost of education. Further, recipients are judged worthy by the institution's assessment on the basis of academic achievement, financial need, and other similar standards. The scholarships and grants are credited directly to the students' accounts and the students do not have direct access to the funds for any other use.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE F, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
column4: PART 1, LINE 2: THE BOARD HAS RESOLVED THAT ALL ORGANIZATIONS TO WHICH IT MAKES GRANTS OR FUNDS PROGRAMS WILL BE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE FOLLOWING: 1. A GRANT APPLICATION WHICH SPECIFIES THE AMOUNT REQUESTED, THE NEED TO BE ADDRESSED, AND A DETAILED PROPOSED USE OF THE FUNDS. 2. IN CASE OF AN ORGANIZATION OUTSIDE THE USA, A COPY OF THE ORGANIZATION'S ORGANIZING DOCUMENTS, REGISTRATION DOCUMENTS WITHIN THE JURISDICTION AND INFORMATION ABOUT THE ORGANIZATION'S ACTIVIIES AND BUDGET IN ORDER TO ENSURE IT IS SUITABLE TO RECEIVE FUNDS FROM A US 501 (C)(3)PUBLIC CHARITY. WHEN A GRANT IS MADE TO AN ORGANIZATION, THE ORGANIZATION WILL BE REQUIRED TO: 1. MAKE A REPORT ON THE USE OF THE FUNDS, TO BE RETURNED TO THE ORGANIZATION WITHING 12 MONTHS OF THE GRANTING OF THE FUNDS. 2. SIGN A STATEMENT THAT THE GRANTEE WILL REFUND ANY PORTION OF THE GRANT NOT USED IN ACCORDANCE WITH TERMS OF THE GRANT. 3. AGREE ANY OTHER CONDITIONS IMPOSED BY THE BOARD DEPENDING ON THE SPECIFICS OF THE GRANT AND THE ORGANIZATION TO WHICH FUNDS ARE BEING GIVEN. NO GRANT WILL BE MADE WITHOUT MEETING THE TERMS SET FORTH BY THE BOARD.

column4: Research subcontracts to foreign entities are entered into through a formal subcontract agreement. Elizabethtown College invests DIRECTLY IN VARIOUS ALTERNATIVE INVESTMENTS THAT MAY BE ORGANIZED AS EITHER FOREIGN CORPORATIONS OR FOREIGN PARTNERSHIPS; IT LIKEWISE, INVESTS IN DOMESTIC LIMITED PARTNERSHIPS THAT MAY, IN TURN, INVEST IN FOREIGN CORPORATIONS OR PARTNERSHIPS. NEVERTHELESS, Elizabethtown College's INVESTMENT ACTIVITIES MAY NOT REACH THE THRESHOLDS REQUIRED FOR THE FILING OF FORMS 926, 5471, 8621, OR 8865. TO THE EXTENT THAT Elizabethtown College iS REQUIRED TO COMPLETE ONE (OR MORE) OF THESE FOREIGN FORMS, they are FILED WITH THE FORM 990-T FILING.
THE AMOUNT REPORTED IN COLUMN (F) REPRESENTS THE FAIR MARKET VALUE OF THE ORGANIZATION'S FOREIGN INVESTMENTS AS OF THE END OF THE FISCAL YEAR.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Part I, Line 3, (1 & 2); Part IV , Lines 1, 3, 4, and 5
column4: By virtue of its investments in various limited partnership investments, Seton Hall University may invest in passive foreign investment companies and/or foreign partnerships; to the extent the University is required to file the Forms 926, 5471, 8621, or 8865, those foreign forms were attached to the University's Form 990-T.

Support for student recruitment and academic exchange program developments. During FY2020, the Stillman School continued to offer an executive-style MBA program in collaboration with Viagold International Education Management Group, with cohorts in Beijing, Shanghai and Zhuhai, China. Students are taught in Mandarin by a combination of Stillman faculty and faculty employed by Chinese universities, and the students spend a week during their final semester at Seton Hall's South Orange campus to complete the MBA program and participate in Graduate Commencement.

The pharmaceutical, biotech, and medical device industries are increasingly facing a more challenging regulatory and enforcement landscape throughout Latin America (LATAM). This intensive, multi-day educational and training certificate program in health care compliance addresses the legal, regulatory, and compliance issues faced by life sciences manufacturers as well as their consultants and third parties doing business in LATAM.

Humanitarian peacebuilding, stabilization, recovery, and development actors provide conflict sensitive programs in Yemen: This project will look to build a shared understand among service providers about the conflict contexts and how to operate most effectively in them, and agreement where possible on collective actions/approaches. It will do this through networking, coordination, strengthening of working relationships, and regular sessions to review available analysis and plan for shared actions.

THE UNIVERSITY HAS IN PLACE INTERNAL CONTROLS TO ENSURE AMOUNTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO CONTINUE TO MEET & MAINTAIN ELIGIBILTY REQUIREMENTS. THESE INTERNAL CONTROLS ARE ADMINISTRATED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.
STUDY ABROAD PROGRAMS AND GRANTMAKING ARE REPORTED ON THE ACCRUAL METHOD. INVESTMENTS ARE REPORTED AT FAIR MARKET VALUE.

THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM OF LOANS, GRANTS, EMPLOYMENT (WORK STUDY) AND SCHOLARSHIPS. THE AWARDS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS MEETING CERTAIN ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS. THE PROGRAMS ARE ADMINISTERED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.

A SCHOLARSHIP IS AN ACHIEVEMENT AWARD. AWARDS CAN BE BASED ON THE STUDENT'S AFFILIATION WITH A PARTICULAR MAJOR, BEING A PART OF A CLUB/GROUP, OR BASED ON THE STUDENT'S ACADEMIC RECORD. STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS FROM THE UNIVERSITY ARE MONITORED TO ENSURE THAT THEY MEET THE ACADEMIC REQUIREMENTS OR OTHER CRITERIA ASSOCIATED WITH THE AWARD. FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED IS ALSO PROVIDED TO STUDENTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE BASED ON NEED ARE MONITORED TO ENSURE THEY MEET ACADEMIC REQUIREMENTS OR OTHER CRITERIA ASSOCIATED WITH THE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE.
ACCRUAL
Expenditures are accounted for using the accrual method of accounting.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule F, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
column4: The College occasionally provides assistance to international students traveling to the US to attend Berea College. Funds used to provide travel assistance are paid from the spendable return of an endowed fund, received by a donor. The account is monitored by the Center for International Education and all funds not used in one fiscal year are then carried over to the next fiscal year. Once a student has expressed a need for travel assistance, the Center for International Education will review the student's initial application to validate need. A student can be awarded the full cost of the travel or only receive a portion. The Center for International Education will make the travel arrangements on behalf of the student. A student can only receive travel assistance once. By donor request, the student is not made aware of the help received until he/she graduates. The student's name and country is also sent to the Development Office, who will also notify the donor of funds used. The student's name, country, and year that funding was received, is also kept on record at the Center for International Education.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule F, Part I, Line 2 PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS
column4: The College occasionally provides assistance to international students traveling to the US to attend Berea College. Funds used to provide travel assistance are paid from the spendable return of an endowed fund, received by a donor. The account is monitored by the Center for International Education and all funds not used in one fiscal year are then carried over to the next fiscal year. Once a student has expressed a need for travel assistance, the Center for International Education will review the student's initial application to validate need. A student can be awarded the full cost of the travel or only receive a portion. The Center for International Education will make the travel arrangements on behalf of the student. A student can only receive travel assistance once. By donor request, the student is not made aware of the help received until he/she graduates. The student's name and country is also sent to the Development Office, who will also notify the donor of funds used. The student's name, country, and year that funding was received, is also kept on record at the Center for International Education.

MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES: HOWARD UNIVERSITY USES PROGRAM-SPECIFIC GUIDELINES TO MONITOR THE PROGRESS OF GRANT ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES. THE GUIDELINES OUTLINE THE SCOPE OF WORK, ESTABLISHED DEADLINES, AND THE CONTENT OF SPECIFIC REPORTS/DELIVERABLES IN A MANNER CONSISTENT WITH THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THE FUNDING AGENCY AND GRANT AWARD. PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATORS PREPARE PROGRAMMATIC PROGRESS REPORTS (MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, ANNUALLY AS REQUIRED) THAT ASSESS PROGRAM ACTIVITIES, IDENTIFY PROBLEMS OR ISSUES AND MODIFY THE DESIGN OR IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PROJECT AS NECESSARY. THE GRANTS AND CONTRACTS ACCOUNTING OFFICE PREPARES MONTHLY FINANCIAL AND BILLING REPORTS FOR INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL REVIEW. THIS OVERSIGHT ENSURES ACCURACY AND COMPLIANCE IN FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT, PROPER MAINTENANCE OF GRANT MANAGEMENT DOCUMENTATION, AND THE ACHIEVEMENT OF PROGRAMMATIC DELIVERABLES AND MILESTONES.
BOOK VALUE

The University monitors the use of grant funds for research sub-awards outside the United States by requiring technical reports which are reviewed and approved by the University before submitting payment. We also have a comprehensive monitoring process by which all sub-recipients are evaluated prior to obtaining an award. Research expenditures for this program are for undergraduates, these are pre-approved by the funding agency and technical reports are submitted upon completion of trip for review and approval. All University expenditure guidelines are followed before payments are disbursed for program expenditures. Grant funds are verified in the student financial aid process according to University procedures and distributed as credits to student receivable accounts at the University.
The University utilizes the accrual method of accounting.

CMU DISTRIBUTES LIMITED FINANCIAL AID AND GRANT FUNDS TO STUDENTS AT ITS INTERNATIONAL LOCATIONS PURSUANT TO A STATISTICAL MODEL THAT TAKES INTO ACCOUNT A STUDENT'S INTENDED COLLEGE MAJOR, ACADEMIC AND ARTISTIC TALENTS, AS WELL AS FINANCIAL NEED. SUCH FUNDS ARE TYPICALLY APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THEIR INDIVIDUAL ACCOUNTS IN FURTHERANCE OF THEIR EDUCATION AT CMU. SPONSORED PROJECT FUNDS ARE PASSED THROUGH TO SUB-GRANTEE ORGANIZATIONS BY CARNEGIE MELLON WHEN SUCH SUB-GRANTEE ARRANGEMENTS ARE APPROVED BY THE PRIMARY GRANT SPONSOR. THESE FUNDS ARE MONITORED BY THE OFFICE OF SPONSORED PROJECTS AND SPONSORED PROJECTS ACCOUNTING.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE F, PART I, LINE 2
column4: MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS THE COLLEGE HAS DEVELOPED AN INSTITUTIONAL AWARDING PHILOSOPHY TO ENSURE CONSISTENT, EQUITABLE, AND FAIR DISTRIBUTION OF FINANCIAL AID FUNDS. PACKAGING PARAMETERS ARE PERIODICALLY REVIEWED WITH THE HELP OF AN OUTSIDE CONSULTANT, TO EVALUATE THE MMC GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAMS OFFERED TO ALL STUDENT POPULATIONS AT MMC. THE COLLEGE OFFERS FOREIGN STUDENTS LIMITED FUNDS. ALL STUDENTS ARE MONITORED BY A REVIEW OF THEIR ACADEMIC PROGRESS EACH SEMESTER. THIS REVIEW INCLUDES AN EXAMINATION OF EACH STUDENT'S QUALITATIVE (GPA) AND QUANTITATIVE (CREDITS COMPLETED) STANDARDS. FAILURE TO MEET ONE OR BOTH STANDARDS WILL RESULT IN THE STUDENT'S INSTITUTIONAL AID BEING PLACED IN A WARNING STATUS. CONTINUED FAILURE TO MEET STANDARDS WILL RESULT IN A LOSS OF ELIGIBILITY AND A SUSPENSION OF AID.

column4: THE COLLEGE USES THE ACCRUAL METHOD OF ACCOUNTING TO ACCOUNT FOR EXPENDITURES.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE VERY SELDOM PAID IN CASH. THE SCHOLARSHIPS (WITH THE EXCEPTION OF A FEW SMALL HONORS DAY AWARDS) ARE PLACED DIRECTLY ON THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS AND THE SCHOLARSHIPS NEVER EXCEED THE TOTAL COSTS CHARGED.

THE UNIVERSITY REQUIRES THAT WHEN APPROVING INVOICE PAYMENTS TO SUBRECIPIENTS OF GRANTS AWARDED TO THE UNIVERSITY, THE VALIDITY OF EXPENSES MUST BE VERIFIED ALONG WITH THE ACHIEVEMENT OF SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL PROGRESS BY THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR OR HIS/HER DESIGNEE ON THE INVOICE APPROVING THE PAYMENT. SUBRECIPIENT INVOICES SHOULD INCLUDE INFORMATION THAT CONFORMS TO THE ADMINISTRATIVE REQUIREMENTS PRESCRIBED IN 2 CFR 200, AS APPLICABLE. ALL SUBRECIPIENTS ARE REQUIRED TO MAKE THEIR FINANCIAL RECORDS AVAILABLE FOR REVIEW OR AUDIT BY THE FEDERAL AGENCIES OR PASS-THROUGH ENTITIES AS REQUESTED, UNDER THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THEIR AGREEMENT.

THE FORM 990 IS BASED ON FINANCIAL STATEMENTS THAT ARE PREPARED USING AN ACCRUAL ACCOUNTING METHOD. TO IDENTIFY EXPENDITURES FOR FOREIGN ACTIVITIES, THE UNIVERSITY ADDED REPORTING ATTRIBUTES TO THE COST OBJECTS (OR ACCOUNTS) WHERE EXPENSE ACTIVITY IS RECORDED IN ORDER TO IDENTIFY THE IRS REGION AND ACTIVITY TYPE FOR EACH COST OBJECT. THE EXPENSES REPORTED ARE THE DIRECT EXPENSES FOR ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED IN THE REGION BASED ON THE ACCOUNTING RECORDS INCLUDING TRAVEL DIRECTLY CHARGED TO THE ACTIVITIES. FOR THE 2019 FORM 990, SCHEDULE F, PART I, THE UNIVERSITY IDENTIFIED CERTAIN BUSINESS TRAVEL BETWEEN THE U.S. AND FOREIGN REGIONS. THE AMOUNTS AVAILABLE FROM THE ACCOUNTING RECORDS ARE IDENTIFIED ON LINE 3 AS "BUSINESS TRAVEL AND INCLUDE EXPENSES FOR EMPLOYEES TO ATTEND AND SPEAK AT SEMINARS AND CONFERENCES IN OTHER COUNTRIES AS WELL AS EXPENSES FOR TRAVEL RELATED TO PROGRAM SERVICE ACTIVITIES. TRAVEL EXPENSES WHICH WERE DIRECT EXPENSES FOR PROGRAM SERVICES OR FUNDRAISING ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED IN REGIONS ARE INCLUDED IN THE AMOUNT REPORTED FOR PROGRAM SERVICE AND FUNDRAISING EXPENDITURES BY REGION.

NICHOLS COLLEGE HAS A PARTNERSHIP WITH THE MAASTRICHT SCHOOL OF MANAGEMENT IN THE NETHERLANDS. NICHOLS COLLEGE STUDENTS PAY TUITION TO NICHOLS AND THEN TRAVEL ABROAD TO MAASTRICHT. MAASTRICHT INVOICES NICHOLS FOR THE STUDENTS TUITION AND OTHER EXPENSES. IN FY20 NICHOLS WAS INVOICED $85,477 FROM MAASTRICHT.

TUITION SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ONLY PROVIDED TO STUDENTS IF ATTENDANCE & ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IS MAINTAINED. ACHIEVEMENT IS MONITORED BY REVIEWING GRADES, PROGRESSION, AND COMPLETION OF REGISTERED COURSES. FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE F, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
column4: SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE HEADED BY THE ACADEMIC DIRECTOR. ONCE AWARDED, THE REGISTRAR MAINTAINS ALL OFFICIAL RECORDS, NOTIFIES RECIPIENTS AND CORRESPONDS WITH STUDENTS REGARDING THEIR ACCOUNTS. THE FINANCE OFFICE, HEADED BY THE CHIEF OPERATING OFFICER, IS RESPONSIBLE FOR UPDATING STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND REPORTING TO THE DONORS. THE PRESIDENT REVIEWS FINAL ALLOCATION OF SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS.

The grants used outside of the United States are related to tuition and/or housing accommodations made by Concordia University Chicago on behalf of its students taking part in established study abroad programs. In these cases, Concordia has entered into agreements with various institutions of higher education in order to allow its students to study at a university outside of the United States. These agreements facilitate the payment of tuition and accommodations by requiring the home institution to collect payment from the student and then forward that payment to the university outside of the U.S.

Grants are made to Muhlenberg students studying abroad as well as foreign students enrolled at Muhlenberg. Grants are applied as credits against tuition and fees. Muhlenberg faculty review and approve programs of foreign countries before students are permitted to enroll in programs outside of the U.S..

ELIGIBILITY FOR STUDY ABROAD SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS IS DETERMINED EACH SEMESTER BASED UPON THE RESULTS OF THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) AND ACADEMIC STANDING. THE FINANCIAL PLANNING DEPARTMENT AND TRAVEL COMMITTEE VERIFY SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS AND DETERMINE NEED BEFORE SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE DISTRIBUTED.

GRANT MONITORING PROCEDURES: GRANTS ISSUED BY IMMACULATA UNIVERSITY ARE PRIMARILY IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANTS AWARDED AS PART OF FINANCIAL AID. FINANCIAL AID GRANTS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE DIRECTLY APPLIED BY THE UNIVERSITY TO OFFSET BILLED AMOUNTS (I.E. TUITION) ON THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT, THEREBY REDUCING THE NET BALANCE DUE TO THE UNIVERSITY. STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ASSESSED ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENTS, FINANCIAL NEEDS, AND SIMILAR STANDARDS.

MONITORING USE OF FUNDS THE COLLEGE AWARDS AID TO MEET 100% OF A STUDENT'S DEMONSTRATED NEED. ALL AID IS CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. IF THE STUDENT WITHDRAWS FROM WELLESLEY, THE AID IS ADJUSTED ACCORDINGLY. PAYMENTS IN CONNECTION WITH A STUDY ABROAD PROGRAM ARE MADE WHILE THE STUDENT IS LIVING OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES. HOWEVER, AT THE TIME THE PAYMENT IS MADE, THE STUDENT IS A RESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES.

NORWICH UNIVERSITY OFFERS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS WHO ARE ACCEPTED TO PARTICIPATE IN APPROVED STUDY ABROAD PROGRAMS. IN ORDER TO QUALIFY FOR THE ASSISTANCE, A STUDENT MUST BE ENROLLED FULL-TIME, MUST HAVE ACHIEVED A SATISFACTORY GRADE POINT AVERAGE AT NORWICH UNIVERSITY AND MUST HAVE A DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED. THE OFFICE OF THE PROVOST, WITH ASSISTANCE FROM THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, SELECTS AND MONITORS THE PARTICIPANTS. THE UNIVERSITY IS PROVIDING FUNDING AND VOLUNTEER SIPPORT TO CONSTRUCT A SUNFLOWER OIL FACILITY IN TANZANIA.

THE UNIVERSITY OF DENVER HAS A UNIVERSITY WIDE SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANT ALLOCATION SYSTEM AND PROCESS THAT DISTRIBUTES GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS FOR ALL DIVISIONS OF THE UNIVERSITY. THE PURPOSE AND ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA ARE ESTABLISHED AT THE FUND LEVEL. THE EXPENDITURE OF THIS FINANCIAL RESOURCE IS MONITORED THROUGH A COMPREHENSIVE SOFTWARE SYSTEM WHICH ALLOWS FOR RECONCILIATION, ELIGIBILITY CHECKS, AND PREVENTS OVER EXPENDITURE. THE UNIVERSITY ALSO PARTICIPATES IN ANNUAL INDEPENDENT FINANCIAL AUDITS TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO DOMESTIC AND FOREIGN RECIPIENTS ARE DIRECTLY APPLIED TO THE RECIPIENT'S TUITION AND FEE RECEIVABLE ACCOUNT AND IS APPLIED TO ANY OUTSTANDING CHARGES PRIOR TO DISBURSEMENT OF ANY EXCESS AMOUNTS.
EXPENDITURES LISTED IN PART I ARE REPORTED USING AN ACCRUAL METHOD OF ACCOUNTING.

column4: The Student aid office requires applications from all students requesting student aid. All students receiving scholarships and grants are judged worthy by the Seminarys assessment on the basis of academic achievement, financial need, and other simliar standards. Student aid for students outside the U.S. is typically a reduction of tuition owed and is rarely given directly to the student in the form of cash.
Part IV, Upon review of our foreign investments for the year, the Seminary is not required to file forms 5471, 8865, 926,8621, or FinCEN Form 114.

THE COLLEGE INVESTS IN LIMITED PARTNERSHIPS. SOME OF THESE PARTNERSHIPS HAVE INDICATED TO THE COLLEGE THAT THEY HAVE INVESTED IN PASSIVE FOREIGN INVESTMENT COMPANIES. HOWEVER, EITHER THE PARTNERSHIPS HAVE FILED THE REQUIRED FORM 8621, OR THE PFIC'S DID NOT GENERATE ANY UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME. UNDER THESE FACTS THE COLLEGE IS NOT REQUIRED TO FILE FORM 8621.

THE ORGANIZATION MONITORS FOREIGN EXPENDITURES ON A MONTHLY BASIS. ONCE DURING EACH SEMESTER, THE UNIVERSITY OF REDLANDS TRANSFERS EUROS TO THE FOREIGN OFFICE FOR THE ESTIMATED AMOUNT OF THE FOREIGN OFFICE'S EXPENDITURES FOR THE SEMESTER. AT THE END OF EACH MONTH, THE FOREIGN OFFICE SENDS THE UNIVERSITY OF REDLANDS A LEDGER OF ACTUAL EXPENDITURES AND A CASH RECONCILIATION FOR THE BANK ACCOUNT. THE UNIVERSITY OF REDLANDS EVALUATES AND RECONCILES THE FOREIGN ACCOUNT CASH BALANCE AND UPDATES THE GENERAL LEDGER MONTHLY BASED ON THE ACTUAL DATA RECEIVED. AT THE END OF EACH SCHOOL YEAR, THE FOREIGN OFFICE PROVIDES THE UNIVERSITY OF REDLANDS WITH RECEIPTS AND DOCUMENTATION FOR ALL EXPENDITURES FOR THE YEAR.
The total of the wire amounts sent to the foreign countries and other funds spent traveling to and in the foreign countries for the study abroad and educational programs.
The University meets the exception for tax-exempt organizations with respect to filing Form 8621. Form 8621 is not required to be filed.

Expenditures are accounted for using the accrual method of accounting. All international trips are monitored and maintained in individual non-operating accounts. Participants are required to raise their own funds. Trips abroad include both studies trips (taken for academic credit) and mission trips to encourage a broad range of academic and co-curricular student growth.

HILLSDALE COLLEGE OFFERS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS (STUDENTS ATTENDING HILLSDALE UNDER F-1 STUDENT VISAS) BASED UPON EITHER ACADEMIC MERIT OR DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED. THE ASSESSMENT FOR AWARDING INITIAL MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIP CONSIDERS THE ACADEMIC CREDENTIAL OF THESE INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS. NEED-BASED GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS BASED UPON DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED EVIDENCED FROM INCOME AND ASSET INFORMATION REPORTED ON HILLSDALE COLLEGE'S INTERNATIONAL FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION. RENEWAL OF MERIT-BASED INTERNATIONAL AWARDS ARE CONTINGENT UPON THE INTERNATIONAL STUDENT MAINTAINING A 3.0 OR HIGHER CUMULATIVE GRADE POINT AVERAGE. THIS GRADE POINT THRESHOLD IS MONITORED AT THE CONCLUSION OF EACH ACADEMIC SEMESTER. INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS NOT MEETING THAT GPA THRESHOLD FOR THE FIRST TIME RECEIVE A LETTER REMINDING THEM OF THIS CRITERION. A SECOND SEMESTER BELOW THE 3.0 GPA REQUIREMENT RESULTS IN SCHOLARSHIP PROBATION, AND A THIRD CONSECUTIVE SEMESTER NOT MEETING THIS 3.0 GPA RESULTS IN LOSS OF THE MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIP. RENEWAL OF A NEED-BASED GRANT REQUIRES THAT INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS CONTINUE TO EVIDENCE FINANCIAL NEED EACH YEAR AS DETERMINED BY SUBMISSION OF HILLSDALE'S INTERNATIONAL FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION. (2) HONORARIA AND TRAVEL REIMBURSEMENTS WERE PAID TO VARIOUS INTERNATIONAL SPEAKERS ON CAMPUS AS WELL AS HONORARIA PAID FOR EDITORIAL WORK. (3) TOUR FEES WERE PAID FOR SCHOOL-SPONSORED INTERNATIONAL TRIPS. (4) THE BOOK TOTAL AMOUNT OF INVESTMENTS IN CENTRAL AMERICA AND THE CAYMAN ISLANDS IS $14,806,004.

The Financial aid office maintains a database of all students, their eligibility for grant funds determined through various procedures, the amount awarded and accepted by each student, and documentation of verifying data. The College also has an audit performed in accordance with the requirements of Title 2 U.S. Code of Federal Regulations Part 200 for Federal Awards, in accordance to the financial statement audit.
THE SEMINARY IS NOT REQUIRD TO FILE FORM 5471 BECAUSE IT DOES NOT MEET THE OWNERSHIP REQUIREMENT.

PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS: SCHOLARSHIPS AND SUPPORT FOR STUDY ABROAD PROGRAMS ARE AWARDED BASED ON NEED AND MONITORED ANNUALLY BASED ON STUDENTS' ACADEMIC PROFILES AND GUIDELINES AS PROVIDED TO STUDENTS.
The organization tracked expenditures in accordance with accrual basis of accounting.

HOBART AND WILLIAM SMITH COLLEGES OFFER GRANTS TO STUDENTS ON THE BASIS OF DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED AND/OR ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT. STUDENTS AND THEIR FAMILIES SUBMIT STANDARDIZED APPLICATION MATERIALS TO THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID, WHICH OVERSEES THE PROCESS OF AWARDING SUCH GRANTS. ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA FOR THE VARIOUS GRANTS IS ESTABLISHED BY THE COLLEGES. THE COLLEGES CREDIT THE TUITION ACCOUNTS OF THE STUDENTS WHO ARE AWARDED FINANCIAL AID GRANTS.
EXPENDITURES ARE REPORTED USING THE ACCRUAL METHOD OF ACCOUNTING.
ACCRUAL METHOD

Grant budgets and expenditures are tracked via our accounting software system and transactions can be viewed by looking for specific budgets to ensure the grants are used for the intended purpose and in line with the budget.
Expenditures are accounted for using the accrual method of accounting.

HOPE COLLEGE OFFERS MERIT-BASED ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS TO INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS. THE ASSESSMENT FOR AWARDING THESE MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS IS BASED ON A REVIEW OF THE STUDENT'S APPLICATION, WITH SPECIFIC EMPHASIS ON THE STUDENT'S ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS, AS WELL AS LEADERSHIP AND VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES. STUDENTS ARE ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE THE SCHOLARSHIP FOR A MAXIMUM OF EIGHT (8) SEMESTERS. STUDENTS WHO COMPLETE THEIR DEGREE IN LESS THAN EIGHT (8) SEMESTERS WILL HAVE THEIR SCHOLARSHIP TERMINATED ONCE THE DEGREE REQUIREMENTS ARE MET. RENEWAL IS CONTINGENT UPON THE INTERNATIONAL STUDENT MAINTAINING FULL-TIME ENROLLMENT (12 CREDITS PER SEMESTER), AS WELL AS MAINTAINING SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS, AS DEFINED BY THE HOPE COLLEGE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID. SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IS ASSESSED ANNUALLY, AT THE END OF THE SPRING SEMESTER. STUDENTS NOT MAKING SATISFACTORY PROGRESS MAY APPEAL TO HAVE THEIR SCHOLARSHIP REINSTATED.
REGARDING DIRECT FOREIGN INVESTMENTS, AMOUNTS REPORTED ON PART I, LINE 3, COLUMN F ARE THE BOOK VALUE OF THE INVESTMENTS AS OF JUNE 30, 2020.
THE INVESTMENTS FOR EACH REGION ARE RECORDED USING THE ACCRUAL METHOD OF ACCOUNTING.

THE SCHOOL INVESTS DIRECTLY IN VARIOUS ALTERNATIVE INVESTMENTS THAT MAY BE ORGANIZED AS EITHER FOREIGN CORPORATIONS OR PARTNERSHIPS. IN ADDITION, THE SCHOOL INVESTS IN DOMESTIC LIMITED PARTNERSHIP THAT MAY, IN TURN INVEST IN FOREIGN CORPORATION OR PARTNERSHIPS. NEVERTHELESS, THE INVESTMENT ACTIVITIES MAY NOT REACH THE THRESHOLDS REQUIRED FOR THE FILING OF FORMS 926, 5471, OR 8865. TO THE EXTENT THAT THE SCHOOL IS REQUIRED TO COMPLETE ONE (OR MORE) OF THESE FOREIGN FORMS, IT IS FILED WITH THE SCHOOL'S FORM 990-T.
THE ACCRUAL METHOD WAS USED TO ACCOUNT FOR EXPENDITURES REPORTED IN PART I.

A SCHOLARSHIP IS AN ACHIEVEMENT AWARD. AWARDS CAN BE BASED ON THE STUDENT'S AFFILIATION WITH A PARTICULAR MAJOR, BEING A PART OF A CLUB/GROUP, OR BASED ON THE STUDENT'S ACADEMIC RECORD. STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS FROM THE UNIVERSITY ARE MONITORED TO ENSURE THAT THEY MEET THE ACADEMIC REQUIREMENTS OR OTHER CRITERIA ASSOCIATED WITH THE AWARD. FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED IS ALSO PROVIDED TO STUDENTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE BASED ON NEED ARE MONITORED TO ENSURE THEY MEET ACADEMIC REQUIREMENTS OR OTHER CRITERIA ASSOCIATED WITH THE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITORING PROCEDURES- FORM 990, SCHEDULE F, PART I, LINE 2
column4: SCHOLARSHIPS PROVIDED TO STUDENTS WHILE ABROAD ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S UNIVERSITY ACCOUNT IN THE US AND ARE NON-CASH TRANSACTIONS.
SPRINGFIELD COLLEGE HAS AGREEMENTS WITH ORGANIZATIONS PROVIDING PROGRAM SERVICES TO ENSURE PROPER USE OF EDUCATIONAL AND RESEARCH GRANTS.
THE AMOUNTS REPORTED IN COLUMN (F), TOTAL EXPENDITURES FOR EDUCATION AND RESEARCH, REPRESENT OTHER FOREIGN ACTIVITY EXPENSES IDENTIFIABLE BY REGION AND ACTIVITY IN THE COLLEGE'S ACCOUNTING SYSTEM.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS OUTSIDE THE U.S.
column4: PART I, LINE 2 THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS. MANY SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED ON CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC STRENGTH, ATHLETIC ABILITY, AND LEADERSHIP OR COMMUNITY SERVICE. NON-NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIP FUNDING IS AWARDED THROUGH THE ADMISSION PROCESS AND USUALLY HAS A GRADE POINT AVERAGE (GPA) OR OTHER REQUIREMENT FOR RENEWAL IN SUBSEQUENT YEARS. TYPES OF MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS INCLUDE THE TRUSTEE SCHOLARSHIP, THE PRESIDENT'S SCHOLARSHIP, AND THE INTERNATIONAL SCHOLARSHIP. ALL SCHOLARSHIP AMOUNTS ARE AUTOMATICALLY CREDITED TO THE INDIVIDUAL'S STUDENT ACCOUNT.
PART I, LINE 3 THE BASIS OF ACCOUNTING ON THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS IS ACCRUAL.
THE UNIVERSITY DID NOT MEET THE THRESHOLD FILING REQUIREMENTS FOR FORMS 5471 AND 8621.

IN LIMITED CIRCUMSTANCES, THE UNIVERSITY MAKES CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTIONS TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS TO ADVANCE A SPECIFIC GOAL THAT IS INTEGRAL TO THE UNIVERSITY'S EDUCATIONAL MISSION. THE UNIVERSITY RECEIVES DETAILED REPORTS REFLECTING THE USE OF THESE FUNDS.
ALL EXPENDITURES REPORTED IN PART I, LINE 3, COLUMN (F) ARE BASED ON THE METHOD USED TO ACCOUNT FOR THEM ON THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS WHICH IS ACCRUAL.
THE INVESTMENTS LISTED ON PART I ARE REPORTED AT FAIR MARKET VALUE.

ALL GRANTS REPRESENT SCHOLARSHIP/FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS STUDYING AT THE COLLEGE'S CAMPUS IN THE UNITED STATES. BENNINGTON MONITORS THE USE OF FUNDS THROUGH THE ANALYSIS OF TRANSCRIPTS, GRADES AND WRITTEN NARRATIVES BY BOTH FACULTY AND STUDENTS. PROGRESS TOWARD THE REQUIREMENTS TO COMPLETE A DEGREE IS CLOSELY MONITORED. GRANTS ARE ONLY PROVIDED TO CURRENTLY ENROLLED STUDENTS.
N/A

THE ORGANIZATION GOES THROUGH AN ANNUAL BUDGETING PROCESS FOR THE FUNDS USED AT THE EUROPEAN AND EAST ASIA LOCATIONS. MONTHLY REVIEWS OF FINANCIAL ACTIVITY AND PERIODIC RE-PROJECTIONS ARE PERFORMED ON AN ONGOING BASIS THROUGHOUT THE YEAR TO ENSURE THAT FUNDS ARE ONLY SPENT FOR AUTHORIZED PURPOSES IN FURTHERANCE OF THE ORGANIZATION'S EDUCATIONAL MISSION.
ACCRUAL METHOD IS USED TO ACCOUNT FOR EXPENDITURES.
Magdalen is based in the UK and grants and other assistance is monitored by departments and committees within college, all activity is within the UK.

International students may be awarded grants and scholarships to come to study. Grants and scholarships are awarded by the financial aid office and are monitored and applied to the student account in the business office. Funds are audited annually by independent auditors.

PART I, LINE 3, COLUMN (F) ACCRUAL METHOD.

STUDENT FINANCIAL AID STUDENT FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BY THE COLLEGE'S OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES. AWARDS ARE BASED ON A NUMBER OF FACTORS INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, SCHOLARLY ACHIEVEMENT, DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED, AND ACADEMIC INTERESTS. FUNDS ARE PROVIDED BY SOURCES SUCH AS FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTS; PRIVATE DONORS SUCH AS CORPORATIONS, INDIVIDUALS AND FOUNDATIONS; THE COLLEGE'S ENDOWED FINANCIAL AID FUNDS; AND THE COLLEGE'S OPERATING BUDGET. FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE MADE UP TO A LIMIT OF THE STUDENT'S FINANCIAL NEED. INDIVIDUAL AWARDS ARE MONITORED EXTENSIVELY IN ORDER TO ENSURE THAT STUDENTS ARE MAKING SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS AND THAT THEY DO NOT RECEIVE MORE THAN THEIR DEMONSTRATED NEED. ADJUSTMENTS ARE MADE WHEN APPROPRIATE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE F, PART IV, LN 5
column4: NO FOREIGN FORMS HAVE BEEN FILED ON BEHALF OF BETHANY COLLEGE AS CIRCUMSTANCES DO NOT TRIGGER FILING REQUIREMENTS. BETHANY COLLEGE HAD LESS THAN A 2% OWNERSHIP INTEREST IN FOREIGN INVESTMENTS, LESS THAN $100,000 OF CAPITAL CONTRIBUTIONS WITHIN ITS 12-MONTH FISCAL YEAR, AND DID NOT RECEIVE DIVIDENDS RELATED TO UBIT.

THE UNIVERSITY GRANTS LISTED ON SCHEDULE F REPRESENT INSTITUTIONAL AID PROVIDED TO STUDENTS WHO MATRICULATE AT THE UNIVERSITY. THE AID PROVIDED TO THE STUDENTS IS APPLIED BY THE UNIVERSITY DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNT. AS SUCH, NO MONITORING OF THE GRANT FUNDS ARE REQUIRED BECAUSE THE STUDENT MAY ONLY USE THE SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS TO DEFRAY THE COST OF TUITION.
EXPENDITURES ARE ACCOUNTED FOR USING THE ACCRUAL METHOD OF ACCOUNTING.

STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS. THE UNIVERSITY DETERMINES WHO QUALIFIES FOR LOANS BASED ON ANALYSIS BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. LOANS ARE AWARDED AS PART OF A PACKAGE CONSISTING OF FEDERAL GRANTS, FEDERAL AND UNIVERSITY LOANS, FEDERAL WORK-STUDY AND UNIVERSITY SCHOLARSHIPS. IN ALL CASES, THOSE WHO RECEIVE LOANS HAVE DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED AND HAVE COMPLETED A FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION FORM. THE AMOUNTS RECEIVED ARE ADDED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT TO OFFSET THE COST OF TUITION AND FEES.

THE ACCOUNTING METHOD DETERMINED FOR PROGRAM SERVICES IS BY THE EXPENSES INCURRED IN THAT REGION. INVESTMENTS IN COLUMN (D) ARE BASED UPON THE FAIR MARKET VALUE OF EACH FUND WHILE THE AMOUNT IN COLUMN (F) IS BASED UPON THE COST BASIS.
THE ACCOUNTING METHOD USED TO DETERMINE THE CASH GRANTS IS BASED UPON THE ORGANIZATIONS EXPENSES BOOKED USING ACCRUAL BASIS ACCOUNTING.

TWO METHODS ARE UTILIZED TO GATHER FOREIGN TRAVEL INFORMATION REPORTED ON IRS FORM 990 SCHEDULE F. THE FIRST IS A FOREIGN TRAVEL FORM SUBMITTED BY INDIVIDUALS WHEN THEY RETURN FROM TRAVEL OUTSIDE THE US. THE FORM ASKS FOR COUNTRY TRAVELED TO, NUMBER OF TRAVELERS, ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED, AND TOTAL TRIP EXPENSES. THE SECOND METHOD IS REVIEWING PURCHASE CARD TRANSACTIONS FOR AIRFARE/LODGING PURCHASED FOR OUT OF THE COUNTRY TRAVEL. THE TRANSACTIONS ARE CATEGORIZED BY THE PURPOSE FOR EACH TRIP (I.E. SERVICE LEARNING TRIP TO ETHIOPIA, RESEARCH PRESENTATION IN DENMARK). THE TOTAL TRIP AMOUNTS ARE CALCULATED AND THE NUMBER OF TRAVELERS CONFIRMED WITH THE DEPARTMENT ORGANIZING THE TRIP.

FUNDS ARE NOT USED OUTSIDE OF THE UNITED STATES; RATHER, FUNDS ARE USED BY INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS WHILE ATTENDING SCHOOL IN THE UNITED STATES. AMOUNTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENTS' TUITION ACCOUNTS.
The organization used the cash method of accounting. The organization helped the "Hermanas Franciscanas de San Jose" in Mexico with general support such food, clothes, medical, shelter, etc.

ALL OF ISE'S FOREIGN PROGRAM EXPENSES ARE FOR FIELD TOUR TRIPS. FIELD TOUR OPERATORS ARE VETTED FOR HEALTH, SAFETY AND ORGANIZATIONAL STRENGTH. ISE IS CONFIDENT BEFORE THEY BEGIN WORKING WITH A PROVIDER THAT IT IS A REPUTABLE ORGANIZATION. ALSO, ISE'S POOL OF PROVIDERS IS FAIRLY STABLE AS THEY OFTEN RETURN TO THE SAME DESTINATIONS. ISE HAS NUMEROUS LONG TERM PARTNERSHIPS OF 5 YEARS OR MORE. MOST SERVICES ARE PAID FOR AFTER SERVICES HAVE BEEN PROVIDED ALTHOUGH WE DO USE DEPOSITS FROM TIME TO TIME. ISE TAKES SEVERAL STEPS TO SAFEGUARD PAYMENTS MADE TO FOREIGN SUPPLIERS. 1.) ISE ESTIMATES AND TRACKS ALL EXPECTED PAYMENTS BASED ON PLANNED PROGRAMS AND THEN ACTUAL SALES; 2.) ISE MAKES SOME DEPOSITS IN ADVANCE, BUT FULL PAYMENT IS NOT MADE UNTIL AFTER THE SERVICE HAS BEEN DELIVERED; 3.) ISE USES ISE REPRESENTED LIAISONS ON EACH FIELD TRIP IN ORDER TO ENSURE SAFETY AND THAT ALL TRIPS PROVIDE PROMISED SERVICES; 4). ISE STAYS IN CONTACT WITH ALL PROVIDERS AFTER PAYMENT TO ENSURE THAT THE FUNDS HAVE BEEN SUCCESSFULLY RECEIVED ON THEIR END.

GRANTS ISSUED BY GETTYSBURG COLLEGE ARE PRIMARILY IN THE FORM OF FINANCIAL AID FOR WORTHY AND PROMISING STUDENTS WHO ARE UNABLE TO FINANCE THEIR EDUCATION FROM PERSONAL AND/OR FAMILY RESOURCES. ACCESS TO SUCH AID IS CONSIDERED A PRIVILEGE, NOT A RIGHT. THE QUALIFICATIONS FOR ASSISTANCE, IN ADDITION TO NEED, ARE ACADEMIC ABILITY, ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, AND PROMISE OF CONTRIBUTION AS A STUDENT AND CITIZEN. FINANCIAL AID GRANTS TO STUDENTS ARE DIRECTLY APPLIED BY THE COLLEGE TO OFFSET BILLED AMOUNTS (I.E.TUITION) ON THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT, THEREBY REDUCING THE NET BALANCE DUE TO THE COLLEGE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE F, PART I, LINE 3, COLUMN F
column4: GETTYSBURG COLLEGE USES THE ACCRUAL METHOD OF ACCOUNTING FOR EXPENDITURES. INVESTMENTS ARE REPORTED AT FAIR VALUE IN ACCORDANCE WITH ACCOUNTING STANDARDS. WHENEVER AVAILABLE, QUOTATIONS FROM ORGANIZED SECURITY EXCHANGES ARE USED AS THE BASIS OF FAIR VALUE. FOR INVESTMENTS NOT TRADED ON ORGANIZED EXCHANGES, THEIR NET ASSET VALUE (NAV) PER SHARE OR EQUIVALENT HAVE BEEN USED AS A PRACTICAL EXPEDIENT FOR DETERMINING FAIR VALUE AND ARE SUBJECT TO ADDITIONAL UNCERTAINTY. THEREFORE, VALUES REALIZED UPON DISPOSITION MAY VARY SIGNIFICANTLY FROM CURRENTLY REPORTED VALUES.
EXPENDITURES ARE ACCOUNTED FOR ON THE ACCRUAL BASIS OF ACCOUNTING.
ALTHOUGH THE COLLEGE HAD AN OWNERSHIP IN CERTAIN FOREIGN CORPORATIONS (INVESTMENTS) DURING THE TAX YEAR, THE INVESTMENT AMOUNT WAS NOT HIGH ENOUGH TO RENDER THE FILING OF FORM 5471.

MEREDITH COLLEGE IS AN INVESTOR IN ONE OR MORE PASSIVE FOREIGN INVESTMENT COMPANIES ("PFICS"). THEY RECEIVED NO TAXABLE DISTRIBUTIONS FROM ANY OF THE FUNDS DURING FISCAL YEAR 2020. FORM 8621 IS NOT REQUIRED DUE TO IRS GUIDANCE SET FORTH IN REG. SEC. 1.1291-1(E).
ALTHOUGH THE COLLEGE HAD AN OWNERSHIP IN CERTAIN FOREIGN PARTNERSHIPS (INVESTMENTS) DURING THE TAX YEAR, THE INVESTMENT AMOUNT WAS NOT HIGH ENOUGH TO RENDER THE FILING OF FORM 8865.

RIPON COLLEGE INVESTS IN DOMESTIC AND FOREIGN LIMITED PARTNERSHIPS THAT MAY OWN AN INTEREST IN A FOREIGN CORPORATION, PASSIVE FOREIGN INVESTMENT COMPANY, OR FOREIGN PARTNERSHIP. NEVERTHELESS, THE ORGANIZATION'S INVESTMENT ACTIVITIES ACTIVITIES MAY NOT REACH THE THRESHOLDS REQUIRED FOR FILING THE FORMS 926, 8621, OR 8865. TO THE EXTENT THAT THE ORGANIZATION IS REQUIRED TO COMPLETE ONE OF THESE FOREIGN FORMS, IT HAS BEEN FILED WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S ANNUAL FORM 990-T.

Earlham leads many study abroad programs for its students each year. These programs range in duration from 2 weeks to 6 months long. We track all direct expenses for these programs separately. The expenditures reflected on Line 3 include travel, meals, lodging, cultural events, and salaries for full-time Earlham professors who lead the programs. Expenditures are accounted for using the accrual method of accounting.
Expenditures are accounted for using the accrual method of accounting.

column4: MIT PROVIDES SEVERAL TYPES OF GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE TO FOREIGN INDIVIDUALS. FOR PRIZES AND AWARDS, THE INDIVIDUAL MUST HAVE MET THE SPECIFIC CRITERIA FOR THE PARTICULAR PRIZE OR AWARD TO BE SELECTED. IN THE CASE OF FELLOWSHIPS, THE INDIVIDUAL IS REQUIRED TO UTILIZE THE FUNDS FOR RESEARCH AND STUDY AT THE INSTITUTE. GRANTS ARE MADE IN THE CONTEXT OF ACADEMIC OR RESEARCH PROGRAMS: RECIPIENTS SPEND THEIR GRANT FUNDS UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF THE PROGRAM AND ARE ACCOUNTABLE THROUGH THE PROGRAM FOR THE USE OF THE FUNDS.

A SUBRECIPIENT AGREEMENT IS A RESEARCH SUBCONTRACT WHERE MIT ENGAGES A THIRD PARTY TO PERFORM EXPERIMENTAL, DEVELOPMENTAL, OR RESEARCH WORK GENERALLY IN CONNECTION WITH A SPONSORED RESEARCH AGREEMENT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule F, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
column4: A list of scholarship recipients is on file at the institution and is available upon request. Although there may be recipients who are related to persons having an interest in the institution, such recipients are selected on an equal, objectively determinable basis with other recipients. Saint Mary's College is committed to making it possible for qualified students to enroll at the college regardless of financial circumstances. As part of this commitment, Saint Mary's College offers various levels of academic scholarships, need-based scholarships and institutional grants. Academic scholarship recipients are selected at the time of admission, on the basis of their academic achievements in high school. Need-based scholarships are named for a specific donor or group, and are awarded as part of need-based institutional grant assistance, in accordance with the specific requirements of the scholarship donor. Institutional grants are awarded primarily on financial need as the College is committed to making a Saint Mary's education a possibility for students who demonstrate financial need; each student who applies for financial aid receives consideration for grant assistance. All students receiving scholarships are judged worthy by the institution's assessment on the basis of academic achievement, financial need or other similar standards. Criteria for all scholarships is published and made available to all students and their families. Grant funds/scholarships are credited directly to a student's account to ensure they are used appropriately and for their intended purpose.

Procedures are in place for monitoring the use of grant funds outside the United States. Millsaps sponsors the activities of Kaxil Kiuic, a Mexican Nonprofit Organization. Kaxil Kiuic is dedicated to preserving the environment and the cultural heritage of the Maya by promoting knowledge through educational programs centered at Helen Moyers Biocultural Reserve. Millsaps budgets annually for the funds provided to Kaxil Kiuic and monitors adherence to that budget. The reserve director provides an account of these funds to the reserve Board of Directors. Procedures and conditions are designed to insure that individuals receiving disbursements are adequately investigated to insure that they are qualifying recipients. Students receiving scholarships and fellowships are judged worthy based on the institution's assessment of academic achievement, financial need, and other similar standards.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule F, Part I, Line 2 PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS
column4: The university requires itemized receipts and/or invoices for all expenditures. Transactions are reviewed and approved on multiple levels. This enables monitoring of the types and amounts of funds which are Expended outside of the United States.
PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS OUTSIDE THE US: GRANTS ARE MADE TO ACCREDITED SCHOOLS AND SEMINARIES. BOTH FINANCIAL AND NARRATIVE REPORTS OF GRANT ACTIVITIES ARE REQUIRED.
All grants are applied directly to the student's account to cover a portion of the student's tuition.
THE UNIVERSITY TRACKS ALL FOREIGN STUDY EXPENDITURES USING THE ACCRUAL BASIS OF ACCOUNTING.

SMITH COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIP GRANTS AND LOANS TO STUDENTS WHO DEMONSTRATE FINANCIAL NEED. EACH FAMILY SUBMITS A CONFIDENTIAL QUESTIONNARE THAT IS ASSESSED WITH THE GUIDELINES ISSUED BY THE COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIP SERVICE TO DEFINE NEED. SMITH MEETS THE FULL DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED OF ITS STUDENTS WITH A COMBINATION OF LOANS AND GRANTS. THE COLLEGE ALSO AWARDS SEVERAL MERIT-BASED GRANTS. WORK STUDY OPPORTUNITIES AND PAID INTERNSHIPS BASED ON RIGOUROUS ACADEMIC CRITERIA ARE OFFERED. EMERGENCY AND OTHER STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IS AVAILABLE DEPENDENT ON THE CIRCUMSTANCE WITH THE OBJECTIVE TO MEET THE STUDENT'S FULL DEMONSTRATED NEED. THE COLLEGE MONITORS ALL GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS TO ENSURE THAT FUNDS ARE UTILIZED APPROPRIATELY. GRANTS APPLIED TO COVER TUITION AND OTHER FEES, ARE CONTINGENT ON ACADEMIC PROGRESS. INTERNSHIPS REQUIRE SATISFACTORY PARTICIPATION AND ACADEMIC CONTENT. OTHER FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE REQUIRES DEMONSTRATED NEED.

THE COLLEGE ENCOURAGES STUDY ABROAD FOR ALL OF ITS UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS. THE COLLEGE OPERATES FOUR PROGRAMS IN EUROPE. ADDITIONALLY STUDENTS MAY ATTEND OTHER PREAPPROVED PROGRAMS ABROAD. THE COLLEGE AND ITS EMPLOYEES MAY ENGAGE IN OTHER ACTIVITIES SUCH AS RESEARCH AND FUNDRAISING. FOR STUDY ABROAD, STUDENTS PAY THE COLLEGE THE COMPREHENSIVE FEE NET OF AID IN ACCORDANCE WITH STANDARD COLLEGE FINANCIAL AID POLICIES AND PROCEDURES. THE COLLEGE PAYS FOREIGN SCHOOLS TO PROVIDE TEACHING AND ACCOMMODATIONS. FOREIGN TRAVEL AND OTHER EXPENSES REQUIRE FULL REPORTING UNDER THE COLLEGE'S ACCOUNTABLE PLAN FOR REIMBURSEMENT OF BUSINESS EXPENSES. THE COLLEGE'S INVESTMENT STRATEGY ENCOMPASSES A GLOBAL APPROACH TO INVESTMENT ACTIVITIES. THE ACTUAL LOCATION OF THESE INVESTMENTS MAY VARY SIGNIFICANTLY FROM THE LEGAL DOMICILE OF THE INVESTMENT VEHICLE (FUND-OF-FUNDS).
EXPENDITURES PER REGION ARE REPORTED ON AN ACCRUAL BASIS, WHICH IS THE METHOD USED TO ACCOUNT FOR THEM IN THE ORGANIZATION'S BOOKS AND RECORDS.
METHOD TO ACCOUNT FOR EXPENDITURES ON ORG'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS: CENTRAL AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN: ACCRUAL EAST ASIA AND THE PACIFIC: ACCURAL EUROPE (INCLUDING ICELAND AND GREENLAND): ACCRUAL

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule F, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
column4: DUE TO THE VARIOUS TYPES OF GRANT FUND EXPENDITURES THE UNIVERSITY USES MULTIPLE INTERNAL CONTROL PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS AND ASSISTANCE OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES. FOR FELLOWSHIPS, PRIZES AND STIPENDS, PAYMENTS ARE MADE THROUGH OUR FINANCIAL SERVICES-ACCOUNTS PAYABLE DEPARTMENT. THE PROCESS REQUIRES PRE-APPROVAL BY A PARTICULAR DEPARTMENT-HEAD AND SPECIFIC DOCUMENTATION AND AUTHORIZATIONS ARE NECESSARY IN ORDER TO PROCESS A PAYMENT. FOR INTERNATIONAL PROJECT ADVANCES, A MAJORITY OF THE PAYMENTS ARE WIRED DIRECTLY TO A DESIGNATED FOREIGN BANK ACCOUNT. THE UNIVERSITY HAS REPRESENTATIVES IN THE SPECIFIC REGION WHO MAINTAIN THE CASH FOR EXPENDITURES AND THEIR INTENDED PURPOSES. FOR SCHOLARSHIPS, ALL FOREIGN ADDRESS STUDENTS ARE PROVIDED WITH A CHECK PAYMENT THAT IS PROCESSED FROM THE ACCOUNTS PAYABLE DEPARTMENT. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ADMINISTERS THE LISTING OF PAYEES AND THE FINANCIAL SERVICES OFFICE RECORDS THE TRANSACTIONS AFTER ALL REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION HAS BEEN RECEIVED. FOR SUBCONTRACT RESEARCH GRANTS, A PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR (PI) IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ALL ASPECTS OF A GRANT ALONG WITH THE COMPLIANCE ACTIVITIES. ALL OF THESE PROCEDURES ENSURE THAT GRANT FUNDS USED OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES ARE BEING PROPERLY MONITORED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule F, Part I, Line 2 PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS
column4: DUE TO THE VARIOUS TYPES OF GRANT FUND EXPENDITURES THE UNIVERSITY USES MULTIPLE INTERNAL CONTROL PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS AND ASSISTANCE OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES. FOR FELLOWSHIPS, PRIZES AND STIPENDS, PAYMENTS ARE MADE THROUGH OUR FINANCIAL SERVICES-ACCOUNTS PAYABLE DEPARTMENT. THE PROCESS REQUIRES PRE-APPROVAL BY A PARTICULAR DEPARTMENT-HEAD AND SPECIFIC DOCUMENTATION AND AUTHORIZATIONS ARE NECESSARY IN ORDER TO PROCESS A PAYMENT. FOR INTERNATIONAL PROJECT ADVANCES, A MAJORITY OF THE PAYMENTS ARE WIRED DIRECTLY TO A DESIGNATED FOREIGN BANK ACCOUNT. THE UNIVERSITY HAS REPRESENTATIVES IN THE SPECIFIC REGION WHO MAINTAIN THE CASH FOR EXPENDITURES AND THEIR INTENDED PURPOSES. FOR SCHOLARSHIPS, ALL FOREIGN ADDRESS STUDENTS ARE PROVIDED WITH A CHECK PAYMENT THAT IS PROCESSED FROM THE ACCOUNTS PAYABLE DEPARTMENT. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ADMINISTERS THE LISTING OF PAYEES AND THE FINANCIAL SERVICES OFFICE RECORDS THE TRANSACTIONS AFTER ALL REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION HAS BEEN RECEIVED. FOR SUBCONTRACT RESEARCH GRANTS, A PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR (PI) IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ALL ASPECTS OF A GRANT ALONG WITH THE COMPLIANCE ACTIVITIES. ALL OF THESE PROCEDURES ENSURE THAT GRANT FUNDS USED OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES ARE BEING PROPERLY MONITORED.
INVESTMENTS ARE REVIEWED BY THE INVESTMENT SUBCOMMITTEE OF THE BUSINESS AFFAIRS COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, AS WELL AS BY RIDER'S INVESTMENT MANAGER.
THE ORGANIZATION IS NOT REQUIRED TO FILE FORM 5471 BECAUSE IT DOES NOT MEET THE APPLICABLE OWNERSHIP REQUIREMENT.

INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CODED SEPARATELY IN THE COLLEGE'S ERP SYSTEM. A REPORT IS GENERATED FROM THE COLLEGE'S ERP SYSTEM DETAILING EACH STUDENT AND THEIR SPECIFIC AWARDS. THIS REPORT IS REVIEWED PERIODICALLY TO MONITOR FUNDS.
INVESTMENT ACTIVITY IN PRIVATE EQUITY FUNDS ARE OVERSEEN BY INVESTMENT MANAGER.
METHOD OF ACCOUNTING - ACCRUAL BASIS, INVESTMENTS
STUDENTS STUDYING ABROAD MUST MEET THE SAME CRITERIA AS STUDENTS STUDYING IN THE US

Form 990, Schedule F, Part I, Line 2 PERIODIC SITE VISITS BY COLLEGE ADMINISTRATORS AND FACULTY REVIEW LOCAL OPERATIONS. SIGNIFICANT OPERATIONS HAVE REVIEWS BY LOCAL INDEPENDENT AUDITORS. STUDENTS ARE AWARDED TUITION DISCOUNTS BASED ON VARIOUS CRITERIA. THE DISCOUNTS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNTS.

THE INSTITUTE INVESTS IN DOMESTIC AND FOREIGN INVESTMENT VEHICLES THAT MAY OWN AN INTEREST IN A FOREIGN CORPORATION, PASSIVE FOREIGN INVESTMENT COMPANY, OR FOREIGN PARTNERSHIP. NEVERTHELESS, THE INSTITUTE'S INVESTMENT ACTIVITIES MAY NOT REACH THE THRESHOLDS REQUIRED FOR FILING THE FORMS 926, 5471, 8621 OR 8865. TO THE EXTENT SUCH A FORM WAS COMPLETED, IT HAS BEEN FILED WITH THE INSTITUTE'S FORM 990-T.
Students who are awarded scholarships have funds credited to their account and use is restricted to purposes related to enrollment in a program of study.
Expenses are accounted for using the accrual method of accounting and investments are accounted for using the fair market value.

The College invests in domestic and foreign limited partnerships that may own an interest in a foreign corporation, passive foreign investment company, or foreign partnership. Nevertheless, the College's activities may not reach thresholds required for filing Forms 926, 5471 or 8621. To the extent such a form was completed, it has been filed with the organization's form 990-T.

The University of Lynchburg does not provide grants and other assistance to organizations outside the United States. Financial Aid is awarded to students who attend the University and whose citizenship is outside the United States. This aid is based upon need and merit and is applied to each student's billed tuition and fees account. The University uses the College Board's PowerFaids software to manage its financial aid database and awarding procedures.
AMOUNTS ARE ACCOUNTED FOR UNDER THE ACCRUAL METHOD OF ACCOUNTING.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Part I, Line 2 - Grantmakers Explanation For Monitoring Use of Funds Outside US
column4: Potential grant recipients complete application forms specific to particular grant funding sources. The Financial Aid Office reviews applications to assure that eligibility requirements such as GPA, credit hours, residency and enrollment status are met. Student applicants receive an award letter identifying the funding programs and award amounts are applied as non-cash credit to the student accounts receivable to further assure that proceeds are utilized for the intended purposes. The Registrar's Office provides information such as withdrawal notices to facilitate the Financial Aid Office in periodically monitoring eligibility criteria and assuring that funds not utilized for the intended purpose are returned to the original funding program.
The College tracked expenditures in accordance with accrual basis of accounting. Tuition and fees schedules for the students' studies were used for the study abroad programs.
The organization has analyzed its ownership in foreign organizations through partnership investments and has determined that it does not meet the reporting requirements for Form 926, 8621 and 8865.

SCHOLARSHIPS/GRANTS AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO ARE STUDYING ABROAD ARE APPLIED TO THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. THE SCHOLARSHIPS OFFSET TUITION AND FEES TO REDUCE THE AMOUNT THAT STUDENTS OWE TO THE UNIVERSITY. THUS, THE STUDENTS DO NOT PHYSICALLY RECEIVE THE MONEY. PROCEDURES DO NOT DIFFER FROM THOSE APPLIED TO STUDENTS WHO ARE ATTENDING ON CAMPUS, OTHER THAN VERIFICATION OF PARTICIPATION AND COMPLETION OF THE PROGRAM. THE FOLLOWING ARE THE PROCEDURES FOLLOWED BY THE UNIVERSITY FOR MONITORING THE USE OF SCHOLARSHIP/GRANT FUNDS: THE ACCOUNTING OFFICE NOTIFIES THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE OF AMOUNTS AVAILABLE TO AWARD TO STUDENTS EACH ACADEMIC YEAR. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE SELECTS RECIPIENTS BASED UPON CRITERIA ESTABLISHED FOR EACH TYPE OF FUNDING. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE NOTIFIES THE ACCOUNTING OFFICE OF EXPENDITURES FOR EACH TERM DURING THE ACADEMIC YEAR. AT YEAR-END, THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND ACCOUNTING OFFICE RECONCILES ACCOUNTS FOR ALL FUNDS. THE ADVANCEMENT OFFICE PROVIDES ANNUAL REPORTS TO THE DONORS REGARDING THE USE OF DONOR-CONTRIBUTED SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS (ENDOWED OR ANNUALLY FUNDED).
EXPENDITURES ARE ACCOUNTED FOR UNDER THE ACCRUAL METHOD.
ACCRUAL METHOD

LINE 1: THE COLLEGE HAS DIRECTLY INVESTED IN FOREIGN CORPORATIONS AND FILED THE REQUIRED FORMS 926 FOR THE TAX YEAR. LINE 3: THE COLLEGE HAS DIRECTLY INVESTED IN FOREIGN CORPORATIONS. HOWEVER, THE COLLEGE DOES NOT MEET THE FILING REQUIREMENTS OF FILING FORM 5471 FOR THE TAX YEAR. LINE 4: THE COLLEGE HAS DIRECTLY INVESTED IN A PASSIVE FOREIGN INVESTMENT COMPANY (PFIC). HOWEVER, THE PFIC DOES NOT CREATE ANY UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME FOR THE COLLEGE TO REPORT. UNDER THESE FACTS, IT IS NOT NECESSARY FOR THE COLLEGE TO FILE FORM 8621. LINE 5: THE COLLEGE HAS DIRECTLY INVESTED IN FOREIGN PARTNERSHIPS. HOWEVER, THE COLLEGE DOES NOT MEET THE FILING REQUIREMENTS OF FILING FORM 8865 FOR THE TAX YEAR.
GRANTS ARE GIVEN TO FOREIGN INDIVIDUALS FOR SCHOOLING IN THE US; THEREFORE, THE USE OF TEH FUNDS IS WITH THE GRANTMAKING ORGANIZATION.
Accounting method - accrual

Grants outside of the US consists of Student assistance paid to students. The office of the registrar administers and monitors all awards. See www.queensu.ca/studentawards/financialassistance for more details.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Part I, Line 2 - Grantmakers Explanation For Monitoring Use of Funds Outside US
column4: Use of grants is monitored through required written reporting at regular intervals,on-site visits and evaluations, submission of projected and actual budget documentsand expense reports, and other oversight measures.

MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS - THE COLLEGE MAINTAINS ITS GRANT FUNDS IN INDIVIDUAL GRANT ACCOUNTS AND IS REQUIRED TO BE AUDITED ANNUALLY (A-133/UNIFORM GUIDANCE). IN ADDITION, GRANTS MADE IN FOREIGN COUNTRIES FOR THE PURPOSE OF THE COLLEGE'S STUDY ABROAD PROGRAM ARB ENTERED INTO USING A CONTRACTUAL AGREEMENT OUTLINING THE SERVICES TO BE DELIVERED. THIS ACTIVITY IS MONITORED BY THE GLOBAL EDUCATION OFFICE AND THE BUSINESS OFFICE. THE MANNER OF CASH DISBURSEMENTS TO SCHOLARSHIP AND FINANCIAL AID RECIPIENTS WAS A DIRECT CREDIT TO EACH STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. THE MANNER OF CASH DISBURSEMENTS FOR ALL STUDY ABROAD PROGRAMS IS WIRE TRANSFER.
RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED FOR ALL EXPENDITURES; RECEIPTS ARE REQUIRED FOR ALL REIMBURSEMENTS.
GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO ORGANIZATIONS OUTSIDE THE U.S. IS RELATED TO SERVICE-LEARNING COURSES AND A MISSION TRIP.

SUSQUEHANNA UNIVERSITY INVESTS IN DOMESTIC AND FOREIGN LIMITED PARTNERSHIPS THAT MAY OWN AN INTEREST IN A FOREIGN CORPORATION, PASSIVE FOREIGN INVESTMENT COMPANY, OR FOREIGN PARTNERSHIP. NEVERTHELESS, SUSQUEHANNA UNIVERSITY INVESTMENT ACTIVITIES MAY NOT REACH THE THRESHOLDS REQUIRED FOR FILING THE FORMS 926, 5471, 8621, 8865. TO THE EXTENT THAT SUSQUEHANNA UNIVERSITY. IS REQUIRED TO COMPLETE ONE OF THESE FOREIGN FORMS, IT HAS BEEN FILED WITH THE FORM 990-T.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PART I, LINE 2 - EXPLANATION FOR MONITORING USE OF FUNDS OUTSIDE U.S.
column4: TERMS ABROAD SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BY UNION'S TERMS ABROAD OFFICE TO STUDENTS SCHEDULED TO STUDY ABROAD BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED AND cRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY THE DONOR. THE STUDENT RECEIVING THE AWARD UNDERSTANDS THAT THE FUNDS MUST BE RETURNED TO UNION IF THE STUDENT DOES NOT TRAVEL ABROAD. THE AWARD IS GENERALLY USED FOR THE STUDENT'S TRAVEL EXPENSES, WHICH ARE NOT COVERED BY UNION COLLEGE. UPON HIS/HER RETURN, THE STUDENT IS URGED TO WRITE A PERSONAL NOTE OF THANKS TO THE DONOR DESCRIBING THEIR TERMS ABROAD EXPERIENCE.

THE COLLEGE INVESTS IN DOMESTIC AND FOREIGN INVESTMENT VEHICLES THAT MAY OWN AN INTEREST IN A FOREIGN CORPORATION, PASSIVE FOREIGN iNVESTMENT COMPANY, OR FOREIGN PARTNERSHIP. NEVERTHELESS, THE COLLEGE'S INVESTMENT ACTIVITIES MAY NOT REACH THE THRESHOLDS REQUIRED FOR FILING THE FORMS 926, 5471, 8621 OR 8865. TO THE EXTENT SUCH A FORM WAS COMPLETED, IT HAS BEEN FILED WITH THE COLLEGE'S FORM 990-T. A portion of Union Colleges endowment is invested in funds that are domiciled in offshore locations providing opportunities for tax-advantaged net returns to the endowment.

MADONNA UNIVERSITY OFFERS UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE CLASSES IN EAST ASIA AND THE PACIFIC AND THE MIDDLE EAST AND NORTH AFRICA. MADONNA UNIVERSITY HAS A RELATIONSHIP WITH FOUR DISTINCT ENTITIES TO RECRUIT GROUPS AND INDIVIDUALS FROM EAST ASIA AND THE PACIFIC FOR MADONNA UNIVERSITY UNDERGRADUATE AND MASTER'S PROGRAMS, INCLUDING ON-CAMPUS PROGRAMS, THE 2+2 BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION BACHELOR'S DEGREE COMPLETION PROGRAM, AND MASTER'S PROGRAMS. WE HAVE A CONTRACT THAT IDENTIFIES A PLAN OF STUDY WHICH ESTABLISHES MADONNA UNIVERSITY FACULTY AS THE PRIMARY INSTRUCTORS. WHEN NECESSARY, RESPECTIVE COUNTRIES' INSTRUCTORS MAY TEACH. THROUGH THE USE OF THE INTERNET, MADONNA UNIVERSITY MANAGES ALL INSTRUCTIONAL ACTIVITIES FOR THE COURSES TAUGHT. STUDENTS FOR THE CLASSES ARE RECRUITED BY REPRESENTATIVES IN THEIR COUNTRY. UPON COMPLETION OF THE COURSES, MADONNA WIRES A COMMISSION TO THESE ENTITIES. THE TUITION MADONNA UNIVERSITY CHARGES FOR A CLASS IS LOWER THAN OUR STANDARD PUBLISHED RATE. SO, THE STUDENTS ARE GETTING ASSISTANCE FROM MADONNA UNIVERSITY IN THAT THEY DO NOT PAY OUR FULL TUITION RATE. WE ARE NOT SENDING FUNDS TO FOREIGN COUNTRIES TO BE USED AS THE INDIVIDUAL CHOOSES. WE KNOW THE NUMBER OF STUDENTS AND THE AMOUNT THEY PAY, IN THAT SENSE WE DO MAINTAIN RECORDS. FOR CLASSES IN THE MIDDLE EAST AND NORTH AFRICA REGION, PAYMENT FOR CLASSES IS COLLECTED AND SENT TO MADONNA UNIVERSITY AFTER ALL EXPENSES ARE SUBTRACTED. CLASSES TAUGHT WITH INSTRUCTORS WITH FACE TO FACE CONTACT ARE NOT MADONNA UNIVERSITY EMPLOYEES.

FEDERAL GRANT FUNDS ARE AWARDED IN COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL REGULATIONS APPLICABLE TO THE SPECIFIC PROGRAM. INSTITUTIONAL PROCEDURES ALLOW FOR SEPARATION OF AWARDING AND DISBURSING OF FUNDS. STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE SCHOLARSHIPS AND FEDERAL WORK STUDY FUNDS ARE MONITORED EACH SEMESTER FOR ACADEMIC PROGRESS. ANNUAL AUDITS ARE CONDUCTED BY AN INDEPENDENT CERTIFIED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH ALL PROGRAMS.

THE COLLEGE PROVIDES CERTAIN SCHOLARSHIP AID TO STUDENTS WHILE PARTICIPATING IN STUDY ABROAD PROGRAMS. ELIGIBILITY FOR THE AID IS DETERMINED PRIOR TO DISBURSEMENT AND IS MONITORED PERIODICALLY THROUGHOUT THE TERM OF THE GRANT BY THE COLLEGE'S OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID.
DIRECT COSTS
BAKER UNIVERSITY USES THE ACCRUAL METHOD OF ACCOUNTING FOR EXPENDITURES ON THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
The University accounts for foreign expenditures using the accrual method of accounting.
The organization has analyzed its ownership in the foreign corporation, and has determined that it does not meet the reporting requirements for Schedule 5471.
The organization has analyzed its ownership in the passive foreign investment company and has determined that it does not meet the reporting requirements for Form 8621.
The organization has analyzed its ownership in the foreign partnership and has determined that it does not meet the reporting requirements for Form 8865.

THE ORGANIZATION INVESTS IN PARTNERSHIPS THAT HOLD DIRECT OR INDIRECT INTERESTS IN PASSIVE FOREIGN INVESTMENT COMPANIES. THE INVESTMENT PARTNERSHIPS HAVE PROPERLY FILED FORM 8621, OR THE UNDERLYING INVESTMENTS DID NOT GENERATE ANY UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME. UNDER THESE FACTS, IT IS NOT NECESSARY FOR THE ORGANIZATION TO FILE AN ADDITIONAL 8621.

MCDANIEL COLLEGE PROVIDES FINANCIAL AID THROUGH EDUCATORS LEGACY AND PRESIDENTIAL SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS PARTICIPATING IN STUDY ABROAD EXPERIENCES. STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IS APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS.
MCDANIEL RECEIVED $182,287 IN REVENUE FROM THE PREPARATORY PROGRAM. COURSES WERE TAUGHT USING MCDANIEL CURRICULUM.
